intro: Stellarioides donaldsonii, commonly known as the dwarf starwort, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically opposite, with a hairy texture that helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Stellarioides donaldsonii is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
